name: Pastizz
short_description: Malta's beloved snack features flaky, layered phyllo pastry bursting with savory fillings like peas, ricotta, and anchovies. Each bite offers a delightful crunch and rich flavor that captures the island's culinary spirit.

name: Imqaret
short_description: A beloved Maltese treat, these diamond-shaped pastries boast a luscious filling of dates, citrus, and warm spices, all expertly deep-fried to golden perfection for a delightful crunch.

name: Fenkata
short_description: Malta's national dish celebrates community with tender rabbit marinated in wine, slow-cooked with fragrant herbs and vegetables. Each bite offers a rich taste of tradition and local flavor.

name: Prinjolata
short_description: A festive Maltese delight, Prinjolata features layers of rich sponge cake, creamy filling, and a luscious topping of nuts and chocolate. Traditionally enjoyed during Carnival, it’s a celebration on a plate.

name: Imqarrun il-forn
short_description: Baked to perfection, this Maltese pasta casserole combines hearty penne with rich meat sauce, creamy béchamel, and a sprinkle of cheese. A beloved Sicilian-inspired dish, it's a true comfort food staple.

name: Bebbux
short_description: Cleansed and seasoned, these Maltese land snails, or bebbuxu, are simmered in a rich garlic, parsley, and olive oil sauce, offering a delightful taste of tradition and Mediterranean flair.

name: Figolla
short_description: Delight in the festive Figolla, a Maltese cookie filled with rich marzipan and shaped into adorable lambs or bunnies. Decorated with vibrant icing, these sweet treats celebrate Easter with every bite.

name: Ross il-forn
short_description: Baked to perfection, this Maltese casserole layers savory minced meat and rich tomato sauce with fragrant spices, often finished with a gooey cheese topping. A comforting classic that warms the soul!

name: Ħobż biż-żejt
short_description: Originating from Malta, this open-faced sandwich features crusty sourdough smeared with rich kunserva and drizzled with robust olive oil, creating a delightful blend of savory and tangy flavors.

name: Fenek moqli
short_description: Savory marinated rabbit is sautéed to perfection in Malta’s Fenek moqli, infused with fragrant thyme, garlic, and a splash of dry white wine. A beloved local dish celebrating traditional flavors.

name: Aljotta
short_description: Originating from Malta, this hearty fish soup bursts with the flavors of fresh herbs, garlic, and tangy tomatoes. Traditionally enjoyed during Lent, it features whole fish for a robust, ocean-fresh taste.

name: Ħobż tal-Malti
short_description: Freshly baked in traditional wood-fired ovens, Malta's beloved sourdough bread boasts a rustic crust and a chewy interior. Each loaf reflects local variations, making it a cherished staple in every kitchen.

name: Pork and Potato Casserole (Tal-majjal u patata)
short_description: A hearty Maltese favorite, tender pork and creamy potatoes mingle with aromatic garlic and a kick of hot peppers. Baked to perfection, this casserole embodies rustic comfort and island flavors.

name: Bigilla
short_description: Originating from Malta, this creamy fava bean dip bursts with fresh parsley, mint, and a hint of heat from hot peppers. Perfectly paired with crunchy galletti or toasted sourdough, it’s a must-try snack!

name: Qassatat
short_description: Delight in these flaky Maltese pastries, filled with creamy ricotta or savory spinach and cheese. A beloved snack, qassatat perfectly captures the island's rich culinary heritage.

name: Stuffat tal-qarnit
short_description: A beloved Maltese classic, this hearty octopus stew simmers with garlic, red wine, olives, and capers, creating a rich, savory flavor. Perfect with tender potatoes, it showcases the island's Mediterranean essence.

name: Timpana
short_description: Originating from Malta, this hearty casserole layers tender pasta with savory beef, pork, and rich chicken liver, all enveloped in flaky puff pastry. A delicious blend of flavors that tells a story of tradition.

name: Galletti
short_description: Savory and crisp, these traditional Maltese water crackers blend flour, semolina, and olive oil for a delightful crunch. Perfect as a snack or paired with cheese, they embody Malta’s rich culinary heritage.

name: Patata L-Forn
short_description: Sliced potatoes soak in rich olive oil, layered with fragrant herbs and spices, then baked to a golden crisp. A beloved Maltese classic, it’s the perfect comfort food bursting with flavor.

name: Laħam taż-żiemel
short_description: In Malta, horse meat becomes a tender, aromatic stew, marinated with local herbs and spices, then slow-cooked to perfection. A true cultural delicacy, it offers a unique taste of tradition.

name: Pasta Omelet (Froġa tat-tarja)
short_description: A beloved Maltese classic, this pasta omelet features tender vermicelli enveloped in fluffy eggs, enriched with butter and creamy cow's milk cheese. Savory and satisfying, it's a comforting dish enjoyed by locals.

name: Soppa tal-armla
short_description: Hearty and comforting, Maltese vegetable soup bursts with the flavors of seasonal produce like carrots, potatoes, and broad beans. Slow-cooked to perfection, it embodies the warmth of traditional Maltese cuisine.

name: Pudina tal-ħobż
short_description: Maltese tradition shines in this delightful bread pudding, where soaked bread mingles with eggs, cocoa, nuts, and dried fruits. Enhanced by aromatic orange zest and warming spices, it’s a comforting dessert that captures the essence of island life.

name: Balbuljata
short_description: Savor the essence of Malta with creamy scrambled eggs infused with sautéed tomatoes and onions. Often enhanced with meat or cheese, this comforting dish embodies the island's rustic charm.
